meanings.definition: Full of steam or producing steam.
meanings.sent1: The sauna room became even steamier after the water was poured over the hot rocks.
meanings.sent2: The bathroom was getting steamier as the hot shower ran for a long time.
meanings.sent3: The kitchen got steamier than a sauna when the pot boiled over.
meanings.sent4: The steamier atmosphere in the greenhouse helped the plants thrive.
meanings.sent5: The steamier air made it hard to see through the fogged-up windows.

meanings.definition: Having a high level of heat or intensity.
meanings.sent1: The steamier weather made everyone seek shade to cool off.
meanings.sent2: The competition grew even steamier as the final round approached.
meanings.sent3: The argument between the siblings got steamier as they both raised their voices.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room became steamier with each passing moment.
meanings.sent5: The steamier debate kept the audience on the edge of their seats.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a sense of sensuality or sexual tension.
meanings.sent1: The movie had a steamier scene than expected, causing some viewers to blush.
meanings.sent2: The novel's plot became steamier as the main characters' romance developed.
meanings.sent3: The soap opera became even steamier with the introduction of a new love triangle.
meanings.sent4: The steamier moments in the play left the audience captivated.
meanings.sent5: The steamier chemistry between the actors added depth to their on-screen relationship.
